page.title: 14 WHITEHOUSE FARM INTERVIEW
page.content: Farm has been owned by Mr John Cross since 1950. He owns 80 acres plus 5.5 from Burnt House Farm. It is a mixed farm with a small area for pasture but mainly arable. Small number of store pigs sold for swill fattening also 140 head of calves sold at 5 months- some for beef some for dairy. Few Jersey and Guernsey calves reared from birth for selling. Two thousand head poultry, rear day old chicks and table birds and make 2 egg deliveries to Ipswich. Have hand mill to grind their own corn to add to purchased vitamins for pig food. Farm possibly in first Domesday Book. Mr Cross's own family tree goes back to that date so they were probably a farming family before then but not at Whitehouse Farm. Parts of house 200 years old. 1980's- Farmers still work long hours for not enough reward.
